cons: Some people to have allergic reactions to fenugreek.
Fenugreek may cause body and urine odour similar to that of maple syrup.
description: Fenugreek seeds are a rich source of minerals, vitamins, and phytonutrients. 100 g seeds carry 323 calories. The seeds compose ample amounts of soluble dietary fiber.
Fenugreek helps to reduce cholesterol level, especially that of the low density lipoprotein.
Fenugreek seeds can have surprising benefits for your skin, including eliminating the signs of aging like wrinkles and fine lines.
Fenugreek has a compound named diosgenin that has anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties. This helps fenugreek fight against acne.
Fenugreek seeds can help moisturize and nourish your skin and remove all traces of dryness.
Fenugreek seeds prevent further damage to the heart and counteract the oxidative stress that occurs during a heart attack.
name: Fenugreek Seeds
pros: Fenugreek seeds are a rich source of minerals, vitamins, and phytonutrients. 100 g seeds carry 323 calories. The seeds compose ample amounts of soluble dietary fiber.

Fenugreek seeds can have surprising benefits for your skin, including eliminating the signs of aging like wrinkles and fine lines.

Fenugreek seeds can help moisturize and nourish your skin and remove all traces of dryness.
Fenugreek seeds prevent further damage to the heart and counteract the oxidative stress that occurs during a heart attack.
Fenugreek is safe for pregnant women only when taken in moderate amounts. Excess consumption may lead to early uterine contractions
